intro: Raspalia barnardii, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, yellow, egg-shaped fruits that are encased in a spiky, green husk. These fruits are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor when ripe. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of nutritious food.
